news_header: In 2024, public job vacancies decreased by 22%, while applicants increased by 7%.
news_text: In 2024, the number of public job vacancies fell by 22% from the previous year, according to Kuntarekry statistics. There were over 75,000 vacancies in municipalities, with more than 630,000 applications submitted. The highest recruitment occurred in education, culture, health, and social sectors, but many positions, especially outside growth centers, remain unfilled. The main skills shortages are in war, education, and related fields, prompting several public sector actors to initiate change negotiations or announce the need for improvements.
